text: Has anyone done any work on betfair/requests http and keep alive when it comes to using sessions? It seems that there is some sort of 20 minute timeout, not sure if this is os specific or on the server side. After about 20 minutes (ish) of inactivity on the session I get the dreaded `('Connection aborted.', RemoteDisconnected('Remote end closed connection without response'))`

text: I keep a number of dedicated request threads that sit idle waiting for requests (routed to the least busy thread). Each thread sends a keep-alive request every minute if inactive. I stagger than equally across the minute so if I have 10 threads there is a keep-alive sent every 6 seconds

elements.text: I keep a number of dedicated request threads that sit idle waiting for requests (routed to the least busy thread). Each thread sends a keep-alive request every minute if inactive. I stagger than equally across the minute so if I have 10 threads there is a keep-alive sent every 6 seconds

text: The keep-alive is like a "ping" or sending data down a socket - just keeps the connection from being dropped. It is not needed if you are using the session/thread, but is if it is idle (3 minutes according to previous messages). In this case you are not wasting valuable processing time because it is a quick simple API call

elements.text: The keep-alive is like a "ping" or sending data down a socket - just keeps the connection from being dropped. It is not needed if you are using the session/thread, but is if it is idle (3 minutes according to previous messages). In this case you are not wasting valuable processing time because it is a quick simple API call
